item.title: This Is The Only Luggage Meghan Markle Uses - Forbes
item.description:
This Is The Only Luggage Meghan Markle Uses  Forbes

London: Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex leave Windsor Castle in Ascot Landau carriage during a procession after getting married at St Georges Chapel A former corporate lawyer, Sonja Salmon had clocked a lot of travel miles. But what she couldn’t understand was why there wasn’t a suitcase on the market that catered to the way she packed and travelled. What she wanted was a stylish carryon with an obvious place to put all the things she always packed and needed – toiletries, shoes, lingerie, jewellery, and of course dirty clothes as the trip progressed. Also a case ...

item.title: Serena Williams Urges Meghan Markle To 'Stop Being So Nice' - HuffPost
item.description:
Serena Williams Urges Meghan Markle To 'Stop Being So Nice'  HuffPost

The queen of tennis has told the Duchess of Sussex to ditch the congeniality. Serena Williams said Thursday that her longtime pal, the former Meghan Markle, remains as sweet as ever ― and maybe that should change as she juggles pregnancy and a reportedly tense royal life. “I’m like, ‘How are you?’ and she’s like, ‘No, how are you?’ and I’m like, ‘You’re so sweet, but I’m really asking ― how are YOU?’” Williams told People at an Art Basel event for her clothing line in Miami. “I’m like, ‘Meghan, stop being so nice … you’re the pregnant one, aren’t you supposed to have hormones, why are you s...

item.title: William, Kate, Meghan, and Harry Are Making Nice, for Now at Least - The Daily Beast
item.description:
William, Kate, Meghan, and Harry Are Making Nice, for Now at Least  The Daily Beast

Photo Illustration by The Daily Beast This week began with another set of challenging headlines for the young royals, as the internet continued to feed on the most compelling royal story in years; reports of a rift at the heart of the royal family, with a feud developing between the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge (William and Kate) and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex (Harry and Meghan). However, midweek, a concerted fightback began, with what appeared to be a deliberate leak from Kensington Palace that not only will both families be at Sandringham, the queen’s estate in Norfolk, for Christmas...

item.title: No, Kate Middleton Isn't Stealing Outfit Ideas From Meghan Markle - HuffPost
item.description:
No, Kate Middleton Isn't Stealing Outfit Ideas From Meghan Markle  HuffPost

Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge seemingly pulled a page from her sister-in-law’s stylebook and wore a blazer and trousers (gasp!) that look exactly like something Meghan, Duchess of Sussex would wear. And we must say, the look “Suits” her. The former Kate Middleton stepped out alongside her husband, Prince William, on Wednesday for an in honor of Royal Air Force personnel in Cyprus. She wore high-waisted, wide-legged trousers from Jigsaw with a tucked-in white shirt and an olive blazer (appropriately called the “Duchess wool blazer”) from Smyth, according to Go Fug Yourself, a website devot...

item.title: Boy so overwhelmed by Queen's visit he immediately crawls out of room - The Independent
item.description:
Boy so overwhelmed by Queen's visit he immediately crawls out of room  The Independent

A little boy was so overwhelmed when meeting the Queen that he dropped to his knees and crawled out of the nearest door. Nine-year-old Nathan Grant was so starstruck upon being introduced to the monarch by his adoptive parents, former Fame Academy judges David and Carrie Grant, that he bolted out of the room, shouting "bye" as he left. Onlookers can be seen laughing in a video captured during the exchange while the Queen visited Coram, the UK's oldest children's charity. Based at the site of The Foundling Hospital in London, Coram has been helping vulnerable children since it gained the Roy...

item.title: A Tour Of The Milestone Hotel's New Suite Inspired By Meghan Markle - Forbes
item.description:
A Tour Of The Milestone Hotel's New Suite Inspired By Meghan Markle  Forbes

An exterior view of The Milestone Hotel in London The Milestone Hotel in Kensington has character. And it’s beloved: it’s long been rated number three out of over 1,000 hotels in London. Three Kensington townhouses combined to make one 57-room hotels, from the outside this 1920s building is discreet and unassuming compared to the elaborate interiors revealed once inside. One of 17 hotels in a Red Carnation group, a boutique portfolio of hotels run by Brett Tollman and his wife Bea – they also have property’s in Ireland, South Africa, Switzerland and the United States. Brimming with old-scho...

item.title: Meghan Markle discusses gender equality during surprise visit to London university - The Independent
item.description:
Meghan Markle discusses gender equality during surprise visit to London university  The Independent

The Duchess of Sussex has continued to encourage open conversations about gender equality by discussing the subject while making a surprise visit at a London university. On Wednesday 5 December, the duchess ventured to King’s College London for an event held by the Association of Commonwealth Universities (ACU). During the visit, the duchess took part in conversations about several topics, including human trafficking, modern slavery, gender equality, peace and climate change. - Read more Meghan Markle reunites with women who inspired Grenfell cookbook Her attendance at the discussions wasn’...

item.title: British Neo-Nazis Suggest ‘Race Traitor’ Prince Harry Should Be Assassinated - The Daily Beast
item.description:
British Neo-Nazis Suggest ‘Race Traitor’ Prince Harry Should Be Assassinated  The Daily Beast

Reuters/Phil Noble, A British neo-Nazi group suggested that Prince Harry should be killed for being a “race traitor” after his marriage to American actress Meghan Markle. The group is spreading an image of Prince Harry that includes a gun pointed at his head and a splash of red in the background. A caption reads: “See ya later, race traitor!” Meghan Markel became the first mixed-race woman to join the modern British royal family after she married Harry earlier this year. According to a BBC investigation, the neo-Nazi group identifies itself as the Sonnenkrieg Division, a British offshoot of...

item.title: How the Duchess of Cambridge revolutionised the humble hairband - The Telegraph
item.description:
How the Duchess of Cambridge revolutionised the humble hairband  The Telegraph

Ever since the Duchess of Cambridge stepped up to her Royal duties in 2011 she has flown the flag for lavish hair accessories. From bold hats during state services to traditional ornate fascinators at society weddings, she has always taken a regal approach to Royal dressing and accessories. However since returning from maternity leave this autumn, the Duchess has modernised her once quite formal approach to hair accessories and has brought back traditional styles like the headband and pretty grosgrain ribbons in an elegant, modern way. As the suspected tension between the Duchess of Cambri...

item.title: Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, is expecting her first child - CNN
item.description:
Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, is expecting her first child  CNN

Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, is pregnant with her first child, the UK's royal family has announced. A statement from Kensington Palace said the baby is expected in the spring of 2019. Britain's Queen Elizabeth II will be the child's great-grandmother. The Queen and other members of the royal family congratulated Meghan and her husband, Prince Harry, on Friday as they gathered in Windsor for Princess Eugenie's wedding to Jack Brooksbank, a royal source said Monday, without specifying whether the parents-to-be broke the news at their cousin's wedding. The Queen, the Duke of Edinburgh, the P...

item.title: Amy Schumer: Meghan Markle Is My Nemesis - HuffPost
item.description:
Amy Schumer: Meghan Markle Is My Nemesis  HuffPost

Comedian Amy Schumer lightheartedly dubbed Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, her “nemesis” while offering up life tips in a new video. “Why is she my nemesis? Because she’s pregnant at the same time as me and I’m not letting her get away with that,” Schumer joked in the InStyle segment titled “How To Not Give A Shit What Anybody Thinks.” Schumer, who was explaining how most people are narcissists, continued: “So maybe I’m feeling competitive, like, ‘Oh, Meghan looks better than me and she has a tiny small bump and she’s wearing high heels and I already look 10 months pregnant and I’ve b...

item.title: Meghan and Harry Will Actually Stay in Kate and William’s House at Christmas To Fight Rift Rumors - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Meghan and Harry Will Actually Stay in Kate and William’s House at Christmas To Fight Rift Rumors  The Daily Beast

CHRIS JACKSON Where are you going for Christmas? For Meghan Markle the surprising answer to that question—if recent reports are to be believed—is that she's staying with the in-laws. While royal sources confirmed to The Daily Beast yesterday that both the Sussexes (Harry and Meghan) and the Cambridges (Kate and William) would be spending the festive period ‘in Norfolk,’ it was assumed there would be clear green pasture between the two families, with the newlyweds expected to stay with the queen and the Cambridges at their country home, a manor house on the grounds of the estate. Now, howeve...

item.title: Michelle Obama's Sweet Advice For Meghan Markle Is Simple And Perfect - HuffPost
item.description:
Michelle Obama's Sweet Advice For Meghan Markle Is Simple And Perfect  HuffPost

Michelle Obama has faced her fair share of criticism and praise after many, many years in the public eye. Naturally, this makes the former first lady the right person to share some sound ― and sweet ― advice for Meghan Markle as the Duchess of Sussex deals with a whole new global level of fame. “Like me, Meghan probably never dreamt that she’d have a life like this,” Obama said in a new interview for Good Housekeeping’s January issue. “The pressure you feel ― from yourself and from others ― can sometimes feel like a lot,” she said. “So my biggest piece of advice would be to take some time a...

item.title: Michelle Obama gives Meghan Markle advice on marriage in the public eye - The Independent
item.description:
Michelle Obama gives Meghan Markle advice on marriage in the public eye  The Independent

Having spent eight years living in the White House as half of one of the most powerful duos on the planet, no one is better equipped than Michelle Obama at knowing how to maintain a happy relationship in the public eye. Seven months since she became an official member of the royal family, the Duchess of Sussex has seemingly adapted very well to the role, having recently taken on her first solo project with the release of the Together cookbook. However, being a part of one of the most famous marriages in the world can take its toll, which is why Michelle has shared the advice that she would ...

item.title: Meghan and Kate To Spend Christmas Together As Palace Fights Feud Rumor - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Meghan and Kate To Spend Christmas Together As Palace Fights Feud Rumor  The Daily Beast

PAUL GROVER Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle will spend Christmas together in Sandringham this year, sources tell The Daily Beast, as the palace struggles to contain an explosive story of a rift at the heart of the royal family. Despite rumors that Kate and William would skip Christmas at Sandringham this year in favour of spending the holidays with Kate’s parents, it has emerged that both the Sussexes and the Cambridges will attend church with the queen at Sandringham. The Daily Beast suggested this weekend that “appearing together on Christmas Day will be a useful way for the Sussexes an...

item.title: The fake feud between Meghan and Kate reveals the prejudice of the press - The Guardian
item.description:
The fake feud between Meghan and Kate reveals the prejudice of the press  The Guardian

Clothing is often the only prism through which many publications are able to discuss high-profile women – something Amal Clooney, Michelle Obama and Hillary Clinton know too well. So, when Meghan Markle’s engagement to Prince Harry was announced last year, the media welcomed her into the royal family with an onslaught of articles pitting her outfits against the Duchess of Cambridge’s in a fabricated war of “Who wore it best?” It didn’t matter that they were almost never wearing the same thing – more often than not, they were decked out in different coats or fascinators in a vaguely similar ...

item.title: Priyanka Chopra marries Nick Jonas in three-day wedding spectacular in Rajasthan - The Telegraph
item.description:
Priyanka Chopra marries Nick Jonas in three-day wedding spectacular in Rajasthan  The Telegraph

With a barrage of spectacular fireworks lighting up the night sky over Jodhpur, Priyanka Chopra - a close friend of the Duchess of Sussex - married her fiance Nick Jonas on Saturday. The Indian-born actress, 36, and the 26-year-old American musician tied the knot at the Umaid Bhawan Palace in Rajasthan, just four months after their engagement. Jonas’s father, Paul Kevin Jonas Sr, a Christian pastor, conducted the ceremony, a culmination of three days of celebrations. The couples guests, who had begun arriving at the palace on Thursday afternoon, were presented with special personalized silv...

item.title: Michelle Obama tells Meghan Markle: 'Don't be in a hurry' to launch ambitious projects - The Telegraph
item.description:
Michelle Obama tells Meghan Markle: 'Don't be in a hurry' to launch ambitious projects  The Telegraph

It is surprisingly prescient advice given the slew of recent allegations made about the Duchess of Sussex’s forthright demeanor and demands. And if there is any truth in the anecdotes that have been tumbling forth from behind palace walls detailing “ghastly” rows with her sister-in-law, the Duchess of Cambridge, temper tantrums over tiara choices and staff reduced to tears, she may well take note. Michelle Obama, the former American First Lady and a long-term friend of her husband, the Duke of Sussex, has suggested that the Duchess take her foot off the gas, slow down and remember she is in...

item.title: What A Stink: How Meghan Markle Wanted Air Fresheners For ‘Musty’ 550-Year Old Chapel - The Daily Beast
item.description:
What A Stink: How Meghan Markle Wanted Air Fresheners For ‘Musty’ 550-Year Old Chapel  The Daily Beast

Chris Jackson/GETTY It’s another day of challenging headlines for Meghan Markle this weekend, as two separate reports claim firstly that she asked if air fresheners could be sprayed in the 550-year old chapel in which she was married to Prince Harry in May, and secondly that her relationship with Kate hit the skids after she was slapped down by Kate after she chastised a member of Kate’s staff in the run-up to her weddign to Prince Harry. The Sun reports that Meghan and Kate fell out after Meghan berated a member of Kate’s staff. Kate, 36, is said to have told Meghan: “That’s unacceptable, ...

item.title: How To Sparkle At Your Holiday Parties With This Meghan Markle-Approved Look - Forbes
item.description:
How To Sparkle At Your Holiday Parties With This Meghan Markle-Approved Look  Forbes

What dressing in separates looks like for brand Black Halo. The holidays are here and with everything that’s on your list, the last thing you want to think about is what you’re going to wear to your next gathering with friends, family or co-workers. Instead of going through your closet for an old party dress or quickly clicking through the Internet for a cheap, low-quality option, look to the stars for help and no, we don’t mean your horoscope. Meghan Markle, Kim Kardashian, Mandy Moore and other big names have made some of their most elegant fashion statements through the popular brand Bla...

item.title: Michelle Obama discloses advice for Meghan, Duchess of Sussex - CNN
item.description:
Michelle Obama discloses advice for Meghan, Duchess of Sussex  CNN

Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, has had plenty of guidance from palace staff on how to be a royal. But her latest piece of advice comes from someone closer to home -- former first lady Michelle Obama. "Like me, Meghan probably never dreamt that she'd have a life like this, and the pressure you feel -- from yourself and from others -- can sometimes feel like a lot," Obama told the British magazine Good Housekeeping, according to interview excerpts published Monday. "So my biggest piece of advice would be to take some time and don't be in a hurry to do anything. I spent the first few months in...

item.title: Prince Harry Joins Circus in Zambian Youth Project - VOA News
item.description:
Prince Harry Joins Circus in Zambian Youth Project  VOA News

Clowns on stilts and trampoline artists entertained Britain's Prince Harry on Tuesday when he visited a youth circus in Zambia which is supported by one of Queen Elizabeth's charities. Harry spent the last of his two days in Zambia visiting World War Two veterans in the capital Lusaka before heading to Circus Zambia, a project that helps vulnerable young people to gain skills, education and employment. The monarch's grandson posed for pictures surrounded by performers at the circus, which is funded by The Queen's Commonwealth Trust, a charity supporting young leaders around the world. "All ...

item.title: This Christmas, Harry and Meghan and Kate and William Must Make Nice - The Daily Beast
item.description:
This Christmas, Harry and Meghan and Kate and William Must Make Nice  The Daily Beast

Photo Illustration by Elizabeth Brockway/The Daily Beast Feud or not, it seems likely that the next time the British people will see Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton together in public will be on Christmas Day at Sandringham, on their way in and out of church with the Queen. The Christmas Day picture, as well as being a gift to news organizations on an otherwise dead news day, has always been a kind of stop motion paen to that most royal of virtues; incremental change. The frosty grass in the background, the loyal serfs clustered around the ancient stone building, and, most importantly of a...

item.title: Duke and Duchess of Sussex will move out of Kensington Palace and into Windsor cottage - The Independent
item.description:
Duke and Duchess of Sussex will move out of Kensington Palace and into Windsor cottage  The Independent

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are moving out of Kensington Palace to set up a new home in the grounds of Windsor Castle in preparation for the birth of their first child, who is due in spring 2019. The royal couple have lived in Nottingham Cottage since their engagement last year and will be moving to Frogmore Cottage in early 2019. The 10-bedroom cottage overlooks Frogmore House, which is where the Duke and Duchess had their evening wedding reception in May. - Read more Meghan Markle discusses the effect of social media on mental health “Windsor is a very special place for Their Royal Hig...

item.title: Royal wedding and Trump visit rack up £9m in policing costs - The Guardian
item.description:
Royal wedding and Trump visit rack up £9m in policing costs  The Guardian

Policing costs for the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex at Windsor Castle and the visit of Donald Trump cost more than £9.4m, Thames Valley police have said. Prince Harry and Meghan’s wedding in May, which attracted around 110,000 well-wishers, racked up a security bill of £3.4m. The US president’s brief visit in July for afternoon tea with the Queen at Windsor Castle, dinner hosted by Theresa May at Blenheim Palace, Oxfordshire, and a trip to Chequers, Buckinghamshire, cost £6m. Thames Valley police said it had recovered £7.9m for both policing operations from the Home Office. The...

item.title: Duke and Duchess of Sussex to move to Frogmore House and begin family life - The Telegraph
item.description:
Duke and Duchess of Sussex to move to Frogmore House and begin family life  The Telegraph

Prince Harry and his wife Meghan have decided the time has come to find a place of their own to begin their lives as a family. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have announced they are to leave Kensington Palace, where they have until now lived close to Harry’s brother Prince William, Duke of Cambridge, and his wife Catherine, and relocate 20 miles away to Windsor. The couple will move to the Grade II-listed Frogmore Cottage, on the Windsor Estate, early next year as they prepare for the arrival of their first child in the Spring. Harry and Meghan have lived at Nottingham Cottage, in the groun...
